meanings.definition: The ability of a material to transmit light or other electromagnetic radiation.
meanings.sent1: The transmissivities of the glass allowed sunlight to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the transmissivities of different materials to understand how they interact with light.
meanings.sent3: The party guests were amazed by the transmissivities of the glow sticks in the dark room.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a beacon, with transmissivities that brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The transmissivities of the crystal-clear lake made it a popular spot for photographers.

meanings.definition: The rate at which a fluid or gas can flow through a porous medium.
meanings.sent1: The transmissivities of the sponge determined how quickly water could pass through it.
meanings.sent2: Engineers measure the transmissivities of different soils to plan effective drainage systems.
meanings.sent3: The chef was impressed by the transmissivities of the sieve, which strained the broth perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed with transmissivities, reaching every corner of the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The transmissivities of the wind through the trees created a soothing sound in the forest.
